Authors:
Silvia Natal David Mausse Sitoe, ShuaiFei Chen, Michael J
Wingfield, Jolanda Roux
Title:
Calonectria mossambicensis S. Maússe-Sitoe, S.F. Chen &
Jol. Roux, sp. nov.
Abstract:
On synthetic nutrient-poor agar (SNA) (Nirenburg 1981),
Conidiophores with a stipe bearing penicillate clusters of fertile
branches, stipe extensions and terminal vesicles. Stipes septate,
hyaline, smooth, 58102 × 37 µm; stipe extensions septate, straight to
flexuous, 91203 µm long, 26 µm wide at the apical septum, terminating in
an obpyriform to ellipsoid vesicle, 28 µm diam. Conidiogenous apparatus
3787 µm long, 1959 µm wide; primary branches aseptate, 824 × 27 µm;
secondary branches aseptate, 520 × 19 µm, tertiary branches aseptate,
415 × 16 µm, each terminal branche producing 26 phialides; phialides
doliiform to reniform, hyaline, aseptate, 511 × 24 µm, apex with minute
periclinal thickening and inconspicuous collarette. Macroconidia
cylindrical, rounded at both ends, straight, (35)3846(50) × 36 µm (av.=
42 × 4 µm), 1-septate, lacking a visible abscission scar, held in
parallel cylindrical clusters by colorless slime. Megaconidia,
microconidia and teleomorph not seen.
